text: Blaye () is a commune in the Gironde department in Nouvelle-Aquitaine region in southwestern France. It is one of the five sub-prefectures of the department. ==Geography== Blaye is on the right bank of the Gironde estuary (which is some wide at this point), to the southeast of Bordeaux. The commune has an area of , and its average altitude is ; at the city hall, the altitude is . Blaye and its neighboring communes ===Climate=== The climate of Blaye is Marine West Coast Climate (Köppen climate classification: Cfb), with mild winters and warm summers. ==Population== The inhabitants of Blaye are known, in French, as Blayais (women: Blayaises). With a population of 4,769, Blaye has a population density of inhabitants/km2. It is also the capital of the arrondissement of Blaye and the administrative centre () of the canton of L'Estuaire with 41,046 inhabitants (2014). It is part of the intercommunality Blaye (). === Twin towns === Blaye is twinned with: * Penzberg, North Rhine-Westphalia, Germany * Tàrrega, Lleida, Spain * Măcin, Romania ==Gallery== File:Blaye 001.jpg|Citadel of Blaye.
